ray.rage.asset.shader

Class Shader

  • java.lang.Object
    • ray.rage.asset.AbstractAsset
      • ray.rage.asset.shader.Shader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Asset, Disposable, Managed<AssetManager<? extends Asset>>, Nameable

    public final class Shader
extends AbstractAsset
    A shader contains the source code that gets submitted to specific stages of the graphics pipeline for rendering.
    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera
    See Also:
    ShaderManager

      • setSource

        public void setSource(java.lang.String src)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the source code to be contained by this shader.
        Parameters:
        src - The source code.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the source code string is empty.

      • getSource

        public java.lang.String getSource()
        Returns the source code in this shader.
        Returns:
        The source code, if it has been set. Otherwise null.

      • notifyDispose

        public void notifyDispose()
        Description copied from interface: Disposable
        Explicitly releases the internal resources held by this instance, making it unusable afterwards.

        WARNING: This method is meant to be used internally by the framework and not by game clients. Use directly only if you really know what you're doing.

        Specified by:
        notifyDispose in interface Disposable
        Overrides:
        notifyDispose in class AbstractAsset
